acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=0.000058mg/L of Crustacea (Ceriodaphnia) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as the outside of Category since death is not observed in 2000mg/kg or less (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).Based on rat LD50 value >2000mg/kg.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Rat LC50 (4 hours) value is >0.2mg/L (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). But Category could not be specified only with this data, it was regarded that it cannot beclassified due to data insufficiency.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 135 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: Agricultural Chemicals abstracts

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into Group E according to EPA(Office of Pesticide Programs List of Chemicals Evaluated for Carcinogenic Potential) and A4 (ACGIH, 2003) according to ACGIH. So it was set as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1,not rapidly degrading (BOD:0.2% (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)), and bioaccumulative (BCF=2880 (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although there is information that it corrodes coppers and brass (HSDB (Access on Mar. 2006)), there is no data based on set test methods.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: No data available by regulated examination methods, though "Flammable" (ICSC (J) (1998))

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Because there is a negative result in the mouse micronucleus test using bone-marrow cells from mice, which is an in vivo mutagenicity test using somatic cells (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), the substance was regarded as outside the categories.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Flash point: 148degC (MSDS) and non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at a room temperature

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In the peroral administration reproduction study using rat, and the teratogenicity test using rat, mouse, and rabbit there was no reproductive toxicity in the dose causing general toxicity for parent animals (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). So it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid or solid substances at 140degC are not available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since change of the eye which is adapted for basis of irritation was not admitted in the test applied to the eye of the rabbit (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was set as the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.classification: Not classified (applicable to 72% Water dispersible granule)
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since irritation was not observed in the skin irritation test of 72% granules hidrated agent on rabbits (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as out of category because the skin sensitization test by the Buehler method using guinea pigs showed 0% of positive rate (agrochemical abstract).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, adrenal gland)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (eye)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since in the oral study using rat, paralysis of both legs and a tail, the decrease in activity of brain cholinesterase and adrenal zona fasciculata fatty vacuolization were observed within the given dose of the guidance value range of Category 1, and in the oral study using mouse, acute or subacute keratitis were observed within the given dose of the guidance value range of 2 Category  (all were Agricultural Chemicals abstracts), they were classified into Category 1 (nervous system, the adrenal gland) and Category 2 (eye).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (nervous system). Because the effects resulting from inhibition of cholinesterase activity and the symptoms suggesting the effects on the nervous system were observed in the oral administration tests using rats at the dosage within the guidance values for Category 1(Agricultural Chemical Abstracts).
